title: Songpyeon
description: Traditional Korean half-moon rice cakes steamed with pine needles during Chuseok and filled with sweet fillings.
instructions: Mix glutinous rice flour with hot water and knead until smooth.
Combine sesame seeds, sugar, and honey to make the sesame filling.
Shape dough into small balls, flatten, fill with sweet paste, then fold and seal.
Steam the rice cakes for 15–20 minutes, traditionally over pine needles.
Brush lightly with sesame oil before serving.
